briefTitle: Prospective Biomarkers of Bone Metabolism in Hemophilia A
officialTitle: Prospective Biomarkers of Bone Metabolism in Hemophilia A
summary: One of the major shortcomings in studying bone disease in hemophilia is the lack of fracture outcome data demonstrating the clinical significance of decreased BMD and altered bone biomarkers in the hemophilia population. This study demonstrates that PwH have an increased risk of fracture compared to the general population and that the issue of bone health will increase in importance as the PwH population ages.
